body.p: Smalltalk has a simple syntax based on messages, literals, variables, and block expressions. This simplicity makes Smalltalk very easy to learn.
The language includes higher-level abstractions — classes and metaclasses —, which define the behavior of all objects in the Smalltalk environment.
∏ complies with ANSI standards for Smalltalk syntax, but employs some extensions, such as name spaces.
